rationale: The agent's implementation has several critical issues compared to ground truth: (1) Missing constants EVEN_SHARD_COUNT_ALLOCATOR_KEY and BALANCED_ALLOCATOR_KEY, instead using string literals directly; (2) Missing the loadShardsAllocator() method that properly handles settings.getAsClass() for custom allocators with package prefix support; (3) Uses inline logic in configure() instead of extracting to a dedicated method; (4) Uses manual Class.forName() instead of Elasticsearch's settings.getAsClass() helper which provides automatic package prefixing and suffix handling; (5) Completely missing the test file ShardsAllocatorModuleTests.java which validates all three loading scenarios (default, short key, class name); (6) Incorrect string values ('even_shard_count' vs 'even_shard'); (7) Unnecessary pom.xml change to Java 1.7 not requested by task; (8) Does not initialize shardsAllocator in constructor as ground truth does. The agent's approach is more primitive and less robust than the ground truth, missing the sophisticated class loading mechanism and all tests.
